text: in this video you'll see how to analyze
and debug your applications using amazon
cloudwatch synthetics and aws x-ray
with these services you can detect and
resolve issues before your customers
notice them discover root causes of
ongoing issues and identify performance
bottlenecks for your applications
the aws observability platform provides
tools for infrastructure monitoring
application monitoring and synthetic
monitoring of the end user experience
using amazon cloudwatch synthetics a
fully managed synthetic monitoring
service you can capture the behavior of
your application endpoints and urls by
running configurable scripts called
canaries
when used with cloudwatch service lens
and the service map provided by aws
x-ray canaries also provide a bird's eye
view of your application
in order to access that high-level view
let's enable active tracing with aws
x-ray for one of these canaries
active tracing with x-ray allows us to
see the service requests to our
application and troubleshoot any
performance issues
this feature can be enabled at canary
creation or later simply by selecting
this checkbox
now that we've enabled active tracing
let's drill down into the canary to see
the traces that have been generated
we have a new tab called
traces here we can see the different
traces from this canary run
let's look at the second one on the list
here we can see the timeline for this
trace's segments
we can also view a map for this trace
when problems occur trace maps can be
used to follow individual requests as
they travel through your application and
see which services are responsible
in this case everything looks good
the trace's segment timeline is visible
from this page as well
if this trace had logs associated with

we can also view our canary in the

this map is powered by cloudwatch

view of our application to help us

bottlenecks and identify impacted users
we can see our canaries node on the map
we can see some basic analytics about

dashboard will give us access to many
more
the information here can help determine
if there's an increase in errors faults

we can view traces from here as well
amazon cloudwatch synthetics with x-ray
integration allows us to correlate
failures in the application with the
impact on end customers determine the
root cause of issues and identify the
upstream and downstream services
affected
